intro: Gelidocalamus xunwuensis, commonly known as the Xunwu bamboo, is a rare and cold-tolerant grass species native to China. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect culms that can grow up to several meters in height. The plant thrives in cool, moist environments, often found in mountainous regions with well-drained soils. Its leaves are long and narrow, with a smooth texture and a slightly hairy underside. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is considered an important species for botanical research and conservation efforts.
